baseNetwork

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • baseNetwork.WebServer

  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for creating and maintaining a single server thread for sending messages and any number of client threads used to communicate with connected clients

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  WebServer.ClientMessage
      Interface for a message that was sent by the client to the server.
      static interface  WebServer.ClientMessageParser
      Parser provided to the WebServer during construction responsible for converting the raw string value of a received message into the appropriate ClientMessage object
      static interface  WebServer.OnMessageReceivedListener
      Listener used to alert the program at large of a newly received message from a client.
      static interface  WebServer.ServerMessage
      Interface for a message being sent from the server to clients.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebServer(int port, WebServer.OnMessageReceivedListener clientListener, WebServer.ClientMessageParser parser)
      Creates the server thread, but does not start it yet.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void notifyClients(WebServer.ServerMessage message, java.lang.String... toNotify)
      sends the given message to the given clients.
      void startServer()
      Starts the server thread, allowing clients to connect.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebServer

        public WebServer(int port,
                 WebServer.OnMessageReceivedListener clientListener,
                 WebServer.ClientMessageParser parser)
        Creates the server thread, but does not start it yet. To do that, use the startServer() method
        Parameters:
        port - the port to start the server on
        clientListener - listener used to receive messages from connected clients
        parser - parser used to instantiate and populate newly received client messages

    • Method Detail

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Starts the server thread, allowing clients to connect.

      • notifyClients

        public void notifyClients(WebServer.ServerMessage message,
                          java.lang.String... toNotify)
        sends the given message to the given clients.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send to the given clients
        toNotify - the identifiers of all clients to notify
